intro: Seseli annuum, commonly known as common sesel, is an annual herbaceous plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, clustered umbels of white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has finely divided, fern-like leaves. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia and is often found in meadows, fields, and along roadsides. Seseli annuum is known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
